trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting ATA using the performance counters | Microsoft ATA
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting ATA using the performance counters | Microsoft ATA

trans-unit.source: Describes how you can use performance counters to troubleshoot issues with ATA
trans-unit.target: Describes how you can use performance counters to troubleshoot issues with ATA

trans-unit.source: Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7
trans-unit.target: Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting ATA using the performance counters
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting ATA using the performance counters

trans-unit.source: The ATA performance counters provide insight into how well each component of ATA is performing.
trans-unit.target: The ATA performance counters provide insight into how well each component of ATA is performing.

trans-unit.source: The components in ATA process data sequentially, so that when there's a problem, it might cause partial dropped traffic somewhere along the chain of components.
trans-unit.target: The components in ATA process data sequentially, so that when there's a problem, it might cause partial dropped traffic somewhere along the chain of components.

trans-unit.source: In order to fix the problem, you have to figure out which component is backfiring and fix the problem at the beginning of the chain.
trans-unit.target: In order to fix the problem, you have to figure out which component is backfiring and fix the problem at the beginning of the chain.

trans-unit.source: Use the data found in the performance counters to understand how each component is functioning.
trans-unit.target: Use the data found in the performance counters to understand how each component is functioning.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [ATA architecture](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-architecture) to understand the flow of internal ATA components.
trans-unit.target: Refer to [ATA architecture](/advanced-threat-analytics/plan-design/ata-architecture) to understand the flow of internal ATA components.

trans-unit.source: **ATA component process**:
trans-unit.target: **ATA component process**:

trans-unit.source: When a component reaches its maximum size, it blocks the previous component from sending more entities to it.
trans-unit.target: When a component reaches its maximum size, it blocks the previous component from sending more entities to it.

trans-unit.source: Then, eventually the previous component will start to increase **its** own size until it blocks the component before it, from sending more entities.
trans-unit.target: Then, eventually the previous component will start to increase **its** own size until it blocks the component before it, from sending more entities.

trans-unit.source: This happens all the way back to the NetworkListener component which will drop traffic when it can no longer forward entities.
trans-unit.target: This happens all the way back to the NetworkListener component which will drop traffic when it can no longer forward entities.

trans-unit.source: ATA Gateway performance counters
trans-unit.target: ATA Gateway performance counters

trans-unit.source: In this section, every reference to ATA Gateway refers also to the ATA Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: In this section, every reference to ATA Gateway refers also to the ATA Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: You can observe the real time performance status of the ATA Gateway by adding the ATA Gateway's performance counters.
trans-unit.target: You can observe the real time performance status of the ATA Gateway by adding the ATA Gateway's performance counters.

trans-unit.source: This is done by opening "Performance Monitor" and adding all counters for the ATA Gateway.
trans-unit.target: This is done by opening "Performance Monitor" and adding all counters for the ATA Gateway.

trans-unit.source: The name of the performance counter object is: "Microsoft ATA Gateway".
trans-unit.target: The name of the performance counter object is: "Microsoft ATA Gateway".

trans-unit.source: Here is the list of the main ATA Gateway counters to pay attention to:
trans-unit.target: Here is the list of the main ATA Gateway counters to pay attention to:

trans-unit.source: Counter
trans-unit.target: Counter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Threshold
trans-unit.target: Threshold

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Microsoft ATA Gateway\NetworkListener PEF Parser Messages/Sec
trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Gateway\NetworkListener PEF Parser Messages/Sec

trans-unit.source: The amount of traffic being processed by the ATA Gateway every second.
trans-unit.target: The amount of traffic being processed by the ATA Gateway every second.

trans-unit.source: No threshold
trans-unit.target: No threshold

trans-unit.source: Helps you understand the amount of traffic that is being parsed by the ATA Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Helps you understand the amount of traffic that is being parsed by the ATA Gateway.

trans-unit.source: NetworkListener PEF Dropped Events/Sec
trans-unit.target: NetworkListener PEF Dropped Events/Sec

trans-unit.source: The amount of traffic being dropped by the ATA Gateway every second.
trans-unit.target: The amount of traffic being dropped by the ATA Gateway every second.

trans-unit.source: This number should be zero all of the time (rare short burst of drops are acceptable).
trans-unit.target: This number should be zero all of the time (rare short burst of drops are acceptable).

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.source: ATA GW Counter/NetworkListener ETW Dropped Events/Sec
trans-unit.target: ATA GW Counter/NetworkListener ETW Dropped Events/Sec

trans-unit.source: The amount of traffic being dropped by the ATA Gateway every second.
trans-unit.target: The amount of traffic being dropped by the ATA Gateway every second.

trans-unit.source: This number should be zero all of the time (rare short burst of drops are acceptable).
trans-unit.target: This number should be zero all of the time (rare short burst of drops are acceptable).

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.source: ATA GW Counter/NetworkActivityTranslator Message Data # Block Size
trans-unit.target: ATA GW Counter/NetworkActivityTranslator Message Data # Block Size

trans-unit.source: The amount of traffic queued for translation to Network Activities (NAs).
trans-unit.target: The amount of traffic queued for translation to Network Activities (NAs).

trans-unit.source: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 100,000)
trans-unit.target: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 100,000)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.source: ATA GW Counter/EntityResolver Activity Block Size
trans-unit.target: ATA GW Counter/EntityResolver Activity Block Size

trans-unit.source: The amount of Network Activities (NAs) queued for resolution.
trans-unit.target: The amount of Network Activities (NAs) queued for resolution.

trans-unit.source: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 10,000)
trans-unit.target: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 10,000)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.source: ATA GW Counter/EntitySender Entity Batch Block Size
trans-unit.target: ATA GW Counter/EntitySender Entity Batch Block Size

trans-unit.source: The amount of Network Activities (NAs) queued to be sent to the ATA Center.
trans-unit.target: The amount of Network Activities (NAs) queued to be sent to the ATA Center.

trans-unit.source: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 1,000,000)
trans-unit.target: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 1,000,000)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.source: ATA GW Counter/EntitySender Batch Send Time
trans-unit.target: ATA GW Counter/EntitySender Batch Send Time

trans-unit.source: The amount of time it took to send the last batch.
trans-unit.target: The amount of time it took to send the last batch.

trans-unit.source: Should be less than 1000 milliseconds most of the time
trans-unit.target: Should be less than 1000 milliseconds most of the time

trans-unit.source: Check if there are any networking issues between the ATA Gateway and the ATA Center.
trans-unit.target: Check if there are any networking issues between the ATA Gateway and the ATA Center.

trans-unit.source: Timed counters are in milliseconds.
trans-unit.target: Timed counters are in milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: It is sometimes more convenient to monitor the full list of the counters by using the "Report" graph type (example: real time monitoring of all the counters)
trans-unit.target: It is sometimes more convenient to monitor the full list of the counters by using the "Report" graph type (example: real time monitoring of all the counters)

trans-unit.source: ATA Lightweight Gateway performance counters
trans-unit.target: ATA Lightweight Gateway performance counters

trans-unit.source: The performance counters can be used for quota management in the Lightweight Gateway, to make sure that ATA doesn't drain too many resources from the domain controllers on which it is installed.
trans-unit.target: The performance counters can be used for quota management in the Lightweight Gateway, to make sure that ATA doesn't drain too many resources from the domain controllers on which it is installed.

trans-unit.source: To measure the resource limitations that ATA enforces on the Lightweight Gateway, add the following counters:
trans-unit.target: To measure the resource limitations that ATA enforces on the Lightweight Gateway, add the following counters:

trans-unit.source: Open "Performance Monitor" and adding all counters for the ATA Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Open "Performance Monitor" and adding all counters for the ATA Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: The name of the performance counter objects are: "Microsoft ATA Gateway" and "Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater".
trans-unit.target: The name of the performance counter objects are: "Microsoft ATA Gateway" and "Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater".

trans-unit.source: Counter
trans-unit.target: Counter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Threshold
trans-unit.target: Threshold

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater\GatewayUpdaterResourceManager CPU Time Max %
trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater\GatewayUpdaterResourceManager CPU Time Max %

trans-unit.source: The maximum amount of CPU time (in percentage) that the Lightweight Gateway process can consume.
trans-unit.target: The maximum amount of CPU time (in percentage) that the Lightweight Gateway process can consume.

trans-unit.source: No threshold.
trans-unit.target: No threshold.

trans-unit.source: This is the limitation that protects the domain controller resources from being used up by the ATA Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: This is the limitation that protects the domain controller resources from being used up by the ATA Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to add more resources to the server running the domain controller..
trans-unit.target: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to add more resources to the server running the domain controller..

trans-unit.source: Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater\GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Commit Memory Max Size
trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater\GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Commit Memory Max Size

trans-unit.source: The maximum amount of committed memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process can consume.
trans-unit.target: The maximum amount of committed memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process can consume.

trans-unit.source: No threshold.
trans-unit.target: No threshold.

trans-unit.source: This is the limitation that protects the domain controller resources from being used up by the ATA Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: This is the limitation that protects the domain controller resources from being used up by the ATA Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to add more resources to the server running the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to add more resources to the server running the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater\GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Working Set Limit Size
trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Gateway Updater\GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Working Set Limit Size

trans-unit.source: The Maximum amount of physical memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process can consume.
trans-unit.target: The Maximum amount of physical memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process can consume.

trans-unit.source: No threshold.
trans-unit.target: No threshold.

trans-unit.source: This is the limitation that protects the domain controller resources from being used up by the ATA Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: This is the limitation that protects the domain controller resources from being used up by the ATA Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to add more resources to the server running the domain controller.
trans-unit.target: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to add more resources to the server running the domain controller.

trans-unit.source: In order to see your actual consumption, refer to the following counters:
trans-unit.target: In order to see your actual consumption, refer to the following counters:

trans-unit.source: Counter
trans-unit.target: Counter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Threshold
trans-unit.target: Threshold

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Process(Microsoft.Tri.Gateway)\%Processor Time
trans-unit.target: Process(Microsoft.Tri.Gateway)\%Processor Time

trans-unit.source: The amount of CPU time (in percentage) that the Lightweight Gateway process is actually consuming.
trans-unit.target: The amount of CPU time (in percentage) that the Lightweight Gateway process is actually consuming.

trans-unit.source: No threshold.
trans-unit.target: No threshold.

trans-unit.source: Compare the results of this counter to the limit found in GatewayUpdaterResourceManager CPU Time Max %.
trans-unit.target: Compare the results of this counter to the limit found in GatewayUpdaterResourceManager CPU Time Max %.

trans-unit.source: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to dedicate more resources to the Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to dedicate more resources to the Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: Process(Microsoft.Tri.Gateway)\Private Bytes
trans-unit.target: Process(Microsoft.Tri.Gateway)\Private Bytes

trans-unit.source: The amount of committed memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process is actually consuming.
trans-unit.target: The amount of committed memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process is actually consuming.

trans-unit.source: No threshold.
trans-unit.target: No threshold.

trans-unit.source: Compare the results of this counter to the limit found in GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Commit Memory Max Size.
trans-unit.target: Compare the results of this counter to the limit found in GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Commit Memory Max Size.

trans-unit.source: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to dedicate more resources to the Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to dedicate more resources to the Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: Process(Microsoft.Tri.Gateway)\Working Set
trans-unit.target: Process(Microsoft.Tri.Gateway)\Working Set

trans-unit.source: The amount of physical memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process is actually consuming.
trans-unit.target: The amount of physical memory (in bytes) that the Lightweight Gateway process is actually consuming.

trans-unit.source: No threshold.
trans-unit.target: No threshold.

trans-unit.source: Compare the results of this counter to the limit found in GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Working Set Limit Size.
trans-unit.target: Compare the results of this counter to the limit found in GatewayUpdaterResourceManager Working Set Limit Size.

trans-unit.source: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to dedicate more resources to the Lightweight Gateway.
trans-unit.target: If you see that the process reaches the maximum limit often over a period of time (the process reaches the limit and then starts to drop traffic) it means that you need to dedicate more resources to the Lightweight Gateway.

trans-unit.source: ATA Center performance counters
trans-unit.target: ATA Center performance counters

trans-unit.source: You can observe the real-time performance status of the ATA Center by adding the ATA Center's performance counters.
trans-unit.target: You can observe the real-time performance status of the ATA Center by adding the ATA Center's performance counters.

trans-unit.source: This is done by opening "Performance Monitor" and adding all counters for the ATA Center.
trans-unit.target: This is done by opening "Performance Monitor" and adding all counters for the ATA Center.

trans-unit.source: The name of the performance counter object is: "Microsoft ATA Center".
trans-unit.target: The name of the performance counter object is: "Microsoft ATA Center".

trans-unit.source: Here is the list of the main ATA Center counters to pay attention to:
trans-unit.target: Here is the list of the main ATA Center counters to pay attention to:

trans-unit.source: Counter
trans-unit.target: Counter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Threshold
trans-unit.target: Threshold

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Microsoft ATA Center\EntityReceiver Entity Batch Block Size
trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Center\EntityReceiver Entity Batch Block Size

trans-unit.source: The number of entity batches queued by the ATA Center.
trans-unit.target: The number of entity batches queued by the ATA Center.

trans-unit.source: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 10,000)
trans-unit.target: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 10,000)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Center\NetworkActivityProcessor Network Activity Block Size

trans-unit.source: The number of Network Activities (NAs) queued for processing.
trans-unit.target: The number of Network Activities (NAs) queued for processing.

trans-unit.source: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 50,000)
trans-unit.target: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 50,000)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Center\EntityProfiler Network Activity Block Size

trans-unit.source: The number of Network Activities (NAs) queued for profiling.
trans-unit.target: The number of Network Activities (NAs) queued for profiling.

trans-unit.source: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 10,000)
trans-unit.target: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 10,000)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.target: Microsoft ATA Center\CenterDatabase * Block Size

trans-unit.source: The number of Network Activities, of a specific type, queued to be written to the database.
trans-unit.target: The number of Network Activities, of a specific type, queued to be written to the database.

trans-unit.source: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 50,000)
trans-unit.target: Should be less than the maximum-1 (default maximum: 50,000)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is any component that reached its maximum size and is blocking previous components all the way to the NetworkListener.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the **ATA Component Process** above.

trans-unit.source: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.
trans-unit.target: Check that there is no issue with the CPU or memory.

trans-unit.source: Timed counters are in milliseconds
trans-unit.target: Timed counters are in milliseconds

trans-unit.source: It is sometimes more convenient to monitor the full list of the counters using the graph type for Report (example: real time monitoring of all the counters).
trans-unit.target: It is sometimes more convenient to monitor the full list of the counters using the graph type for Report (example: real time monitoring of all the counters).

trans-unit.source: Operating system counters
trans-unit.target: Operating system counters

trans-unit.source: The following is the list of main operating system counters to pay attention to:
trans-unit.target: The following is the list of main operating system counters to pay attention to:

trans-unit.source: Counter
trans-unit.target: Counter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Threshold
trans-unit.target: Threshold

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time
trans-unit.target: Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time

trans-unit.source: The percentage of elapsed time that the processor spends to execute a non-Idle thread.
trans-unit.target: The percentage of elapsed time that the processor spends to execute a non-Idle thread.

trans-unit.source: Less than 80% on average
trans-unit.target: Less than 80% on average

trans-unit.source: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more processor time than it should.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more processor time than it should.

trans-unit.source: Add more processors.
trans-unit.target: Add more processors.

trans-unit.source: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.
trans-unit.target: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.

trans-unit.source: The "Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time" counter may be less accurate on virtual servers, in which case the more accurate way to measure the lack of processor power is through the "System\Processor Queue Length" counter.
trans-unit.target: The "Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time" counter may be less accurate on virtual servers, in which case the more accurate way to measure the lack of processor power is through the "System\Processor Queue Length" counter.

trans-unit.source: System\Context Switches/sec
trans-unit.target: System\Context Switches/sec

trans-unit.source: The combined rate at which all processors are switched from one thread to another.
trans-unit.target: The combined rate at which all processors are switched from one thread to another.

trans-unit.source: Less than 5000*cores (physical cores)
trans-unit.target: Less than 5000*cores (physical cores)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more processor time than it should.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more processor time than it should.

trans-unit.source: Add more processors.
trans-unit.target: Add more processors.

trans-unit.source: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.
trans-unit.target: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.

trans-unit.source: The "Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time" counter may be less accurate on virtual servers, in which case the more accurate way to measure the lack of processor power is through the "System\Processor Queue Length" counter.
trans-unit.target: The "Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time" counter may be less accurate on virtual servers, in which case the more accurate way to measure the lack of processor power is through the "System\Processor Queue Length" counter.

trans-unit.source: System\Processor Queue Length
trans-unit.target: System\Processor Queue Length

trans-unit.source: The number of threads that are ready to execute and are waiting to be scheduled.
trans-unit.target: The number of threads that are ready to execute and are waiting to be scheduled.

trans-unit.source: Less than 5*cores (physical cores)
trans-unit.target: Less than 5*cores (physical cores)

trans-unit.source: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more processor time than it should.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more processor time than it should.

trans-unit.source: Add more processors.
trans-unit.target: Add more processors.

trans-unit.source: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.
trans-unit.target: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.

trans-unit.source: The "Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time" counter may be less accurate on virtual servers, in which case the more accurate way to measure the lack of processor power is through the "System\Processor Queue Length" counter.
trans-unit.target: The "Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time" counter may be less accurate on virtual servers, in which case the more accurate way to measure the lack of processor power is through the "System\Processor Queue Length" counter.

trans-unit.source: Memory\Available MBytes
trans-unit.target: Memory\Available MBytes

trans-unit.source: The amount of physical memory (RAM) available for allocation.
trans-unit.target: The amount of physical memory (RAM) available for allocation.

trans-unit.source: Should be more then 512
trans-unit.target: Should be more then 512

trans-unit.source: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more physical memory than it should.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is a specific process that is taking a lot more physical memory than it should.

trans-unit.source: Increase the amount of physical memory.
trans-unit.target: Increase the amount of physical memory.

trans-unit.source: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.
trans-unit.target: Reduce the amount of traffic per server.

trans-unit.source: LogicalDisk(*)\Avg.
trans-unit.target: LogicalDisk(*)\Avg.

trans-unit.source: Disk sec/Read
trans-unit.target: Disk sec/Read

trans-unit.source: The average latency for reading data from the disk (you should choose the database drive as the instance).
trans-unit.target: The average latency for reading data from the disk (you should choose the database drive as the instance).

trans-unit.source: Should be less than 10 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: Should be less than 10 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: Check if there is a specific process that is utilizing the database drive more than it should.
trans-unit.target: Check if there is a specific process that is utilizing the database drive more than it should.

trans-unit.source: Consult with your storage team/vendor if this drive can deliver the current workload while having less than 10ms of latency.
trans-unit.target: Consult with your storage team/vendor if this drive can deliver the current workload while having less than 10ms of latency.

trans-unit.source: The current workload can be determined by using the disk utilization counters.
trans-unit.target: The current workload can be determined by using the disk utilization counters.

trans-unit.source: LogicalDisk(*)\Avg.
trans-unit.target: LogicalDisk(*)\Avg.

trans-unit.source: Disk sec/Write

trans-unit.source: The average latency for writing data to the disk (you should choose the database drive as the instance).

trans-unit.target: Should be less than 10 milliseconds

trans-unit.target: \LogicalDisk(*)\Disk Reads/sec

trans-unit.target: The rate of performing read operations to the disk.

trans-unit.source: No threshold

trans-unit.target: \LogicalDisk(*)\Disk Read Bytes/sec
